Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not submit EBI information for quarter 3.
Correction Narrative: The operation submitted EBI data for the third quarter. The operation set automatic calendar reminders to go off before the due dates to ensure the data is submitted timely. The operation added more staff to the calendar reminders as an extra layer to ensure compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child files did not contain documentation that the children's parents were notified of the initial service plan timely.
Correction Narrative: Agency Director contacted RCCR Inspector to discuss follow-up. Training was conducted with the Case Managers regarding service plan meetings.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation could not provide document of a serious incident report during inspection.
Correction Narrative: Operation provided documented SIR for this incident as well as plan moving forward to ensure that all SIR are documented correctly. Documentation located on SHAREDRIVE

Deficiency Narrative: Supervision protocol was not followed as a child was left at the operation alone.
Correction Narrative: Operation submitted a plan to address ongoing for the operation that states, during the Supervision and Special Actions section of each childs Initial Service Plan, their case manager will adjust their supervision protocol based off their age and level of development. This will allow the operation to ensure adequate care and supervision of children. The initial service plan will also include unsupervised activities a child may participate in such as going to the movies, going on a jog, going to work, etc.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation did not report second incident of children being left alone at movie theatre.
Correction Narrative:
RCCR received the following response in regard to the deficiency cited: 
In response to the above investigation the following processes have been reviewed and amended. Creation of Serious Incident Report Excel Spreadsheet now includes additional verbiage found on the spreadsheet in red font to include when children are left without supervision at the shelter or on an agency outing. 
The excel spreadsheet is used to assist in complying with minimum standard guidelines which include types of serious incidents, if a report needs to be completed for licensing and when, if parents/guardians need to be notified and when, if law enforcement needs to be notified and when, and if documentation needs to be written. 
The excel spreadsheet is very specific and easy for all to follow. It is shown on the spreadsheet that anytime a serious incident occurs, a report to licensing needs to be completed. The report number will need to be gathered to put in the Serious Incident Report as well. 
The excel spreadsheet is accessible to all staff and can be found in the staff office.

An excel spreadsheet was also submitted detailing what situations are deemed reportable to CCR. Documents will be uploaded to the Shared Drive.

Correction Narrative: An email was received with a document with the updated menu including the meal substitutions added.
